Member Function Documentation

int SharedHttpHeader::addBytes (  const unsigned char *  bytes,
int  len
) 
 

Show the SharedHttpHeader the bytes that have been read from a socket.

The SharedHttpHeader will return the number of bytes consumed. If the header is complete (i.e. the double CR/LF pair has been received) the SharedHttpHeader will consume any more bytes, they are part of the body of the message.

Parameters:
bytes Bytes to add to the header.
len Max number of bytes to read into the header.
Returns:
Number of bytes consumed or -1 if an error occurs.

bool SharedHttpHeader::complete (   )  const
 

Returns true if the header is fully read.

const char* SharedHttpHeader::getHeaderValue (  const char *  key  )  const
 

Returns the value of the headerline matching the key.

(Apart from the first line).

Parameters:
key String to look for among the headers, e.g. "Content-Length". Shall not contain the ":".
Returns:
Value or NULL if not present.

const int SharedHttpHeader::getStatusCode (   )  const
 

Parses the first line containing "HTTP/1.X YYY STR" line and returns YYY.

Returns:
The status code of the first line of http-data.
